column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Understand Why People Do Bad Things
#Text=Sometimes people might do bad things and it can be confusing why .

#Text=For some people these acts seems incomprehensible , and hard to believe that the acts were in fact committed however if your willing to go the distance and investigate on each individual , then let this article be your guide .
#Text=We 'll help you understand more about these vicious behaviors .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Know their current mood and situation .
#Text=Before prejudices it helps that you know what they are experiencing currently .
#Text=It helps to ask : What mood are they currently in ?
#Text=What could have caused him to act this way ?
#Text=It helps if you can inquire about his situation through a little chat .
#Text=Talk to him about it ; however be careful to know the point at which he is willing to share .
#Text=Being too inquisitive may not be the best thing to do for some people .
#Text=Reminder
#Text=( Their current mood can be signs of their mood at the time he did it and more importantly it shows what emotions the person is currently feeling after doing " bad things " .
#Text=Guilt can be signs that the action was unintentional or forced .
#Text=Any emotions could be clues linking his personality and the events . )
#Text=( Take into account their situation .
#Text=Ask yourself what would you do if you were in his situation ?
#Text=Would you repeat his mistakes or would you consider different .
#Text=Take into account the pressure he could have been through .
#Text=Maybe his actions were unavoidable ; take into account every variable and every factor available . )
#Text=Know their personality .
#Text=Are they usually like this ?
#Text=Do they show concern for what they have done ?
#Text=Are there signs of him having a " cold blooded attitude " ?

column1: #Text=Does he have a personality disorder ?
#Text=You must take into account all the sides of his personality .
#Text=Think about possible motives .
#Text=Maybe he was forced into committing the act ?
#Text=Did he do it for revenge ?
#Text=Was there a motive ?
#Text=Think of every possible reason , and remember to have a good foundation for your claims .
#Text=Let the evidence be your basis , take into account the variables and testimonies , everything that can help in your inquiry .
#Text=Know their background .
#Text=How did he act during his younger days ?
#Text=Was he neglected ?
#Text=Did he have trouble with his social life ?
#Text=Are there people who may have influenced his actions ?
#Text=Remember that every little detail helps .
#Text=Formulate a hypothesis .
#Text=After gathering all the details , you 're finally ready to make sense of it all .
#Text=Now it 's time to connect the dots .
#Text=Add all the details , variables and factors up .
#Text=And finally when everything is said and done , check your results .
#Text=Are you satisfied with your results ?
#Text=Did you double check the details ?
#Text=If so then you finally have your reason .
#Text=Compare your results .
#Text=After knowing what finally caused his actions , it helps if you compare your results with anyone else who may have been interested with the case .
#Text=How do your results differ ?
#Text=Are they major or minor details ?
#Text=How can you make it that your results and their results comply with a joint hypothesis ?
#Text=After comparing with others , and making a joint theory , only then do you have your final result .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Always base your theories on the truth , have a reliable source and make sure that there are no overlooked details .
#Text=People usually do bad things even though they know it 's bad .
#Text=This is the case a lot of the time but to an extent .
#Text=It helps to take notes .
#Text=If possible have the person your investigating help you in your inquiry .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Remember to have an open mind in your judgment .

#Text=Remember that nowadays nothing is impossible , people are more than capable of committing unforgivable acts , however you should also take into account that not all people are evil , we should take into account our own human nature , our survival instinct , everything is a factor .
#Text=Remember that it is in our human nature to do bad things every now and then .
#Text=However always remember that there are limits in life where bad things are not just your everyday bad things .

#Text=Remember that attempting to understand people is very hard , if you have experience in psychology ( even if you do n't ) you know that even with years of experience and training nothing can quite prepare you for each individual .
#Text=Remember that when doing an inquiry about people , respect their privacy , sometimes it 's best to leave some people alone .
